shift

GATEWAY OUTAGE PLAN AND
UPDATE

As you are all aware, Shift4 experienced a brief outage on Sunday morning affecting the authorizations
gateway. This type of incident is unacceptable regardless of frequency, duration, or scope of impact.
While the overwhelming majority of Shift4 customers were negligibly impacted, many of our key
accounts were affected.
When an issue of this magnitude occurs, we must all:

1. Understand exactly what occurred and how we will fix it.
2. Implement measures to prevent this issue from recurring.
3. Be prepared to fully support and communicate updates to our merchants, partners, and vendors.

This plan defines expectations for all relevant Shift4 team members to ensure we limit merchant impact
and improve communication in the event of an outage. It will act as a reference document for all teams
to help solve for any unexpected issues.

COMMUNICATION
In the event of an outage, an active Slack bridge will be used to maintain cross-departmental
communication.
    . The Slack channel #gateway-outage has been created to coordinate all internal
       communication.
    . Senior, Executive, and Board-level resources should be kept aware of high-level developments
       and any progress being made.
    . If the volume of communication on the Slack channel becomes a distraction, a moderator
       may be assigned to control and manage the flow of information.

ROLE-SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES
    . Customer Support
          o All staff must review this plan and be able to execute appropriately.
          o All support managers must be familiar with the most recent network topology map.

     Release and Change Management
Case 2:20-cv-02432-JDW Document 185-6 Filed 07/14/23 Page 5 of 101
          o The Change Management process should be reviewed for any modifications that
             could improve visibility into scheduled maintenance.
          o The Release Management process should ensure all code is fully regression tested.

    9 Platform Engineering
          o The Platform Engineering team is expected to know where our risks are.
          o The gateway architecture should be designed for the highest possible availability.
          o Monitoring and alerting should be reviewed, and changes made if necessary, to flag any
             issues sooner.
          o The Disaster Recovery (DR) site should be regularly tested to ensure it will perform as
             expected in the event of a production outage.

    9 Product Development
          o The development team should follow the change management process.
          o All code must be fully tested, and unit/regression tests should be automated where
             possible.

    e Sales & Marketing
         o Account Managers will communicate outage information to all potentially affected
             customers.
         o Key Account Managers will make direct contact (e.g., phone call, email) with VIP
             customers as soon as reasonably possible.
         o Sales Engineering will assist partners, resellers, and dealers as needed.

    IT SECURITY
    e All staff should be familiar with this plan, understand their obligations, and ensure
       compliance.

Shift4 Introduces Contactless QR Pay Solution

ORLANDO, Fla.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Shift4 Payments, the leader in integrated payment processing
solutions, has introduced QR Pay, a new contactless payment method for restaurants. This solution
allows customers to simply scan a QR code on their receipt or the point-of-sale terminal to pay their
bill with their phone. It provides a completely contactless payment experience that is simple and
convenient.

Click to Tweet

QR Pay supports both single-use QR codes, where the customer scans a unique QR code printed on
their receipt, and dynamic QR codes, which are displayed directly on the screen of a point-of-sale
terminal or payment device. With this solution, customers can quickly scan the QR code, pay their bill
with their phone, and leave - making for a streamlined and efficient checkout process.
QR Pay is currently available on various POS systems powered by Shift4's Lighthouse Business
Management System, including Harbortouch, Restaurant Manager, POSitouch and Future POS. It is
also compatible with the company's SkyTab® mobile payment solution and will soon be available on
additional devices as well as through online ordering.

"As contactless and mobile payments grow in popularity, it's imperative for restaurants to have access
to solutions that can meet these new consumer expectations," said Shift4 Payments CEO Jared
Isaacman. "QR Pay is the perfect solution for restaurants looking to provide a safe and convenient
payment experience for their customers."

For more information on Shift4's contactless payment options, visit shift4.com/contactless.

About Shift4 Payments

Shift4 Payments is the leader in integrated payment processing, delivering a complete ecosystem of
solutions that extend beyond just payments to include a wide range of value-added services. The
company's groundbreaking technologies help power over 350 software providers in numerous
industries, including hospitality, retail, F&B, e-commerce, lodging, gaming, and more. With over 7,000
sales partners, the company securely processes more than 3.5 billion transactions annually for over
Case 2:20-cv-02432-JDW Document 185-6 Filed 07/14/23 Page 10 of 101
200,000 businesses, representing over $200 billion in payments each year. For additional information,
visit shift4.com.

Begin forwarded message:

From: Nate Hirshberg <nhirshberg id="nhtJTw1iOG" data-rand="YzU4xBrnU0"@shift4.com>
Date: December 16, 2019 at 5:15:40 PM EST
To: Distribution <distribution id="xk6suXc99n" data-rand="Epon4Binon"@shift4.com>
Subject: Shift4 Payments Announces Integration with Agilysys rGuest® Pay

SHIFT4 PAYMENTS ANNOUNCES INTEGRATION WITH AGILYSYS
RGUEST® PAY

LAS VEGAS and ATLANTA - December 16, 2019 - Shift4 Payments, the leader in secure payment
processing solutions, today announced an integration with Agilysys, Inc. (Nasdaq: AGYS), a leading
global provider of next-generation hospitality software solutions and services. rGuest® Pay, the
Agilysys secure payment processing gateway, now supports EMV contactless payments through
integration with Shift4's DOLLARS ON THE NET® payment gateway.

Shift4 also recently announced that they provide EMV certification with rGuest Pay for two of the
largest payment application providers in the country, Oracle Payment Interface (OPI) and Dejavoo
Systems. With these EMV integrations, merchants using Agilysys solutions such as InfoGenesis® POS
can process EMV payments through DOLLARS ON THE NET while maintaining Agilysys' high standards
for data security and simplified PCI scope reduction with P2PE and tokenization.
"We are pleased to expand our integration with Shift4 Payments. Our customers will be able to
securely process all types of payments through DOLLARS ON THE NET," said Prabuddha
Bhattacharya, CTO of Agilysys. "Payment security is very important to us and our customers. Shift4 is a
proven leader in this area that we are proud to work with."

"Agilysys is a leading hospitality technology provider with an impressive customer base," said Jared
Isaacman, CEO of Shift4 Payments. "We are excited to offer a fully featured payment solution that will
work seamlessly with rGuest Pay and their various property management and point-of-sale solutions,
providing the best in security, reporting, and support."

For more information, visit shift4.com or agilysys.com.

About Shift4 Payments
Shift4 Payments is the leader in secure payment processing solutions, powering the top POS, PMS,
carts, and business management software used by every type of business. From hotels and restaurants
to retail, entertainment, and e-commerce, Shift4 securely processes more than a billion transactions
every year. The company works with over 33,000 partners across North America and maintains
certifications to every major POS/PMS system, providing merchants with a single, unified platform for all
their payment processing needs, including EMV, tokenization, P2PE, and mobile/contactless
technologies. Shift4's DOLLARS ON THE NET payment gateway provides industry-leading features and
the highest level of reliability that merchants demand.

For more information, visit www.shift4.com.

About Agilysys
Agilysys has been a leader in hospitality software for more than 40 years, delivering innovative guest-
centric technology solutions for gaming, hotels, resorts and cruise, corporate foodservice management,
restaurants, universities, stadia and healthcare. Agilysys offers the most comprehensive software
solutions in the industry, including point-of-sale (POS), property management (PMS), inventory and
procurement, payments, and related applications, to manage the entire guest journey. Agilysys is known
for its leadership in innovation, its midpe service and its customer-centric approach to software
Case 2:20-cv-02432-JDW Document 185-6 Filed 07/14/23 Page 20 of 101
development. Agilysys operates across North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, and India with headquarters
located in Alpharetta, GA.

For more information, visit www.agilysys.com.
